tweets.text:
To vaccinate as many people as possible is crucial to end the pandemic.

Two-time kidney transplant patient Borislava explains how people who get vaccinated protect not only themselves but also those around them. 

More‚§µ
https://t.co/4hcQ03Satp 

#SafeVaccines #VaccinesWork

Full vaccination is the way out of the pandemic.

We have made remarkable progress, but let's not relax our efforts: we need to keep up a high pace of vaccination to get out of this crisis together!

Read more ‚Üí https://t.co/yY7jRo4adQ

#SafeVaccines #StrongerTogether ü©πüá™üá∫ https://t.co/WEPPxlUCVG

European Reference Networks #ERN are networks of üá™üá∫ #healthcare providers, focusing on complex or rare diseases and conditions ü©∫

The clinical exchange programme ü§ù is now open and ongoing for several networks! üåê

Check the first from @EuRefNetworküëâhttps://t.co/IEclc893pz https://t.co/pkzWL8gkIx

We are bringing back the spirit of an open Europe. 

As of today, EU citizens can get their #EUCOVIDcertificate issued and verified across the Union.

Check Re-open EU for the latest travel measures: https://t.co/mvhLXkLFmY

#StrongerTogether

Pleased to launch the Knowledge Centre on #Cancer with @GabrielMariya. 

As our first #EUCancerPlan flagship it will be central to sharing expertise and finding innovative solutions to fight cancer. 

This is key to bring hope to millions of üá™üá∫ cancer patients and their families. https://t.co/6JRJ2lz53b
Here is why you should get vaccinated even if you have had #COVID19 üëá

Hello @CPME_EUROPA, @PGEU and @EFNBrussels! üëã

It's 6 months after the first #COVID19 vaccinations were administered in the EU.

As co-chairs of the #CoalitionForVaccination, how do you feel about this?

#ECDC Director Andrea Ammon:

"Now is the time to walk the extra mile.
We have several #COVID19 vaccines available and every single infection prevented now through our compliance with public health measures, is a life that can be saved by vaccination."

https://t.co/gkfZUyxrZH

Watch liveüî¥

We are now starting the third regular press briefing on #COVID19 vaccines and treatments. 

Don‚Äôt miss our tweets during the press briefing. Follow #EMAPresser

https://t.co/YU1oB7fhCr

During this pandemic, a wide range of EU initiatives were delivered in record time

We have identified specific areas where an even more effective health response is possible¬†in the future

Read the full press release here:
https://t.co/9qJhlINoBU

#HealthUnion #StrongerTogether https://t.co/U7rytxeW6x

Find out how we can reduce the use of #antimicrobials in food-producing animals.
https://t.co/WozhFChoDe

On #WorldEnvironmentDay let's remember:

The fight against #AntiMicrobialResistance must be based on a holistic one health approach including:

üë¶Humans
üê∑Animals and
üå±the Environment

The #EUPharmaStrategy is addressing the challenges of AMR to #KeepAntibioticsWorking‚§µ

The EU Gateway for the EU Digital COVID Certificate is up and running.

This system allows to verify certificates in a secure and privacy-friendly way.

üáßüá¨ üá®üáø üá©üá∞ üá©üá™ üá¨üá∑ üá≠üá∑ üáµüá± have already connected and more countries will follow soon:  https://t.co/uxamA32v9Z #EUCOVIDcertificate https://t.co/YTLtKWE7QJ
@EMA_News link?

4 antiviral monoclonal antibodies are currently under rolling review by EMA. We are confident that some of these reviews will result in authorised treatments against #COVID19 by the third or fourth quarter of 2021. #EMAPresser
#COVID19 treatments are urgently needed. EMA is working with the @EU_Commission on the Therapeutics Strategy. Follow EMA's website for updates: https://t.co/YZCZKoHur0

EMA is in touch with #COVID19vaccine developers to discuss variant strains and how to approach a possible booster dose. Preliminary data on the duration of immunity doesn't show the need for a third dose currently, but more evidence is needed. #EMAPresser

It is important to increase the #COVID19vaccines supply to support vaccination rollout in the üá™üá∫. EMA is working to authorise the expansion of manufacturing capacity and update the authorised storage conditions for the already authorised vaccines. #EMAPresser
EMA continually monitors the safety & effectiveness of #Comirnaty in both children and adults. #EMAPresser

The recommended use of the Comirnaty #COVID19vaccine in children from 12 to 15 will be the same as it is in people aged 16 and above. It is administered as two injections in the muscles of the arm, at least 3 weeks apart. #EMAPresser
EMA‚Äôs human medicines committee #CHMP has today approved an application to extend the use of the Pfizer/BioNTech #COVID19vaccine (Comirnaty) to include children aged 12 to 15. #EMAPresser

Watch live üî¥ 

We are now starting the second regular press briefing on #COVID19 vaccines and treatments. 

Don‚Äôt miss our tweets during the press briefing. Follow #EMAPresser.

As of today, the regulation on medical devices (MDR) is fully applicable.

The new rules will:
üîéprovide more transparency for patients 
üè• improve the safety & quality of medical devices
üá™üá∫ support innovation & strengthen competitiveness

More ‚§µ

#HealthUnion #StrongerTogether
#MentalHealthMatters #MentalHealthEU https://t.co/hytwqaT7MD

Let‚Äôs turn the tide against cancer.

The #EUCancerPlan sets out a new approach to cancer prevention, diagnosis, treatment & care, improving the quality of life at every step.

It‚Äôs time to replace uncertainty with knowledge, and fear with hope.

#HealthUnion #EWAC2021

üîî TODAY is your last chance to submit a proposal for the #EUopendatadays! Speak at the #EUdataviz conference or compete in the #EUdatathon. Applicants from all around the world are welcome. Deadline: 21 May, 23:59 CET. Apply now!
‚úçÔ∏è https://t.co/P5yu0T30Kz https://t.co/M0FOOl5mzO

that we have a new page with all of the current knowledge on the #SARSCoV2 variants of concern/variants of interest*?

Updated every time new important information is gathered by us.

This Friday, üóìÔ∏è on 21 May, we will co-host with @g20org Italy the #GlobalHealthSummit to improve global health security.

Stay up to date via our website ‚Üì #StrongerTogether

urls.title: Europe Calling
urls.description: From the COVID-19 response to the Recovery Plan for Europe, the European Commission is a driving force behind the biggest and most ambitious European policies. How are they going to affect the lives of Europeans? What do citizens and experts think of the E...

tweets.text:
üîõ‚ÄºÔ∏è The new #EuropeCalling #podcast is out ‚ÄºÔ∏èüí™üá™üá∫

üìçWe are bringing EU‚Äôs #COVID19response to the forefront of the episode üò∑ #StaySafe

üéßTune in to listen to Commissioner @SKyriakidesEU  addressing the questions of EU citizens and journalists üó£Ô∏è 

üéßüîå: https://t.co/ZBjX1tW2R9 https://t.co/eBZYE5WUQk

How many Europeans have been vaccinated against #COVID19 so far? How does it look in the specific age groups?

Find all the info in:
- our infographic below
- the Vaccine Tracker: https://t.co/8UVLGS44EB
- & our weekly vaccination overview report: https://t.co/9XYeiefOPN https://t.co/JO9uNBwvJX

@ECDC_EU @TwitterGov @EMA_News And in closing, let's share the simple message that #VaccinesWork 

The pandemic may have focused our attention on the COVID-19 vaccination, but for more than 200 years routine immunisations have been protecting us from severe diseases all over the world. https://t.co/XkdyD97HcB

@EU_Health @TwitterGov @EMA_News We also set up the "#COVID19 Vaccine Tracker", an interactive dashboard that allows to monitor vaccination roll-out and progress in the EU.

You can find it here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/8UVLGS44EB https://t.co/b45EBHmFg1

@TwitterGov @ECDC_EU @EMA_News It can be difficult to assess the accuracy of information on COVID-19. Checking your sources is vital. 

The European Vaccination Information Portal can help! It includes authoritative sources in all EU countries. 

üëÄHave a look:
https://t.co/YW5Pw5PjEk

@EMA_News @TwitterGov @EU_Health Remember this is a new virus. We need more information on how efficient the vaccines are in reducing transmission and how long they work.

In the meantime, all measures ‚Äì #PhysicalDistancing, #HandHygiene, use of #FaceMasks where required ‚Äì are key! https://t.co/YwRIEeYVWM
@EMA_News @EU_Health @ECDC_EU How long does the COVID-19 vaccine protect us for?

@EU_Health @TwitterGov @ECDC_EU Most side effects are identified before a vaccine is licensed. Some side effects are so rare, they may only show up once millions of people have received the vaccine.
The EU's safety monitoring system is set up to rapidly detect and deal with possible safety concerns.

@TwitterGov @EMA_News @ECDC_EU All medicines have side effects, but you need to compare this with the benefits. The most common side effects from vaccination are mild & short lived, such as pain at the injection site.
@EU_Health @EMA_News @ECDC_EU Are vaccines safe?

Hi @EU_Health, @EMA_News, and @ECDC_EU üëã

It's #WorldImmunizationWeek what better time to talk about COVID-19 vaccines? 
 
Let's start with the big question: why should we get vaccinated?

It's still #EuropeanImmunizationWeek !

Today at 3.30 pm CET we'll be having a conversation on twitter with @TwitterGov and our colleagues from @ECDC_EU and @EMA_News. Tune in!

#VaccinesWork
#WorldImmunizationWeek https://t.co/id42tFRZdM

The last EMA-EUnetHTA Bilateral Meeting under Joint Action 3 was held today, concluding collaboration that began with the first bilateral meetings in 2010. EMA/EUnetHTA workplan 2017-2021 joint achievements were reviewed, then a  "Cheers!" to the future was made.

#eunethta #EMA https://t.co/iMROyGYtkN

Vaccines are one of our greatest scientific innovations

Offering protection from & reducing the spread of more than 2‚É£0‚É£serious & life-threatening diseases like measles, pneumonia & cervical cancer

Find out more:
https://t.co/hfib3MUSWD

#VaccinesWork
#EuropeanImmunizationWeek

Get your #vaccination facts right!

During the #COVID19 pandemic make sure you get your information from trusted sources! Watch our animation, visit our portal & don‚Äôt let anyone fool you! https://t.co/c0Kjfyd6lV

#EIW2021 #VaccinesSaveLives! #VaccinesWork! https://t.co/PPXWBr3sBd

living, caring, acting!

#MentalHealthEU #HealthUnion

European Immunization Week is here.

As vaccinations against #COVID19 are taking place, vaccine production has also been ramping up.

In the EU, we have 53 manufacturing sites & we expect an annual production capacity of over 3 billion doses by year-end.

More in #EUDataCrunch ‚Üì

#Covid19 focused our attention on vaccination

But for more than 200 years vaccines have protected billions of people from diseases all over the world

#VaccinesWork and can bring us closer again:
https://t.co/rurRowpQXF

#EuropeanImmunizationWeek

‚úÖ @EU_Commission has granted conditional marketing authorisation to the @JNJNews #COVID19 vaccine. 

üìçFour vaccines are now available for citizens in Europe and beyond. We will continue working with the company to ensure that deliveries will be as seamless as possible.

More safe and effective vaccines are coming to the market. 

We have just authorised the use of Johnson & Johnson's vaccine in the EU, following @EMA_News' positive review. 

With the number of doses we ordered, we could vaccinate up to 200 million people in the EU. https://t.co/YsrcfF9ZE8

Conditional marketing authorisation is the EU‚Äôs regulatory mechanism for use in the current #COVID19 pandemic emergency, to grant all citizens in üá™üá∫ access to a vaccine and to support mass vaccination campaigns. #EMAPublicMeeting2
Very large trials showed that the mRNA vaccines are very effective at preventing #COVID19. Both showed > 90% efficacy and adequate safety profile in clinical trials. #EMAPublicMeeting2

Sabine Straus, PRAC Chair: The PRAC is very aware of our responsibility to EU citizens to collect and analyse every piece of information on the safety of the vaccine. The safety profile of the #COVID19vaccine from the data we have assessed is reassuring.

Emer Cooke, EMA's Exec. Director: I would like to celebrate and acknowledge the tireless work behind the scenes of a high number of experts from all üá™üá∫ Member States and my colleagues in EMA involved in the review of the #COVID19vaccine.

Emer Cooke, EMA's Exec. Director: This is the result of unparalleled mobilisation and sharing of information between scientists, industry, regulators, healthcare professionals and patients around the globe.

Emer Cooke, EMA's Exec. Director: EMA's scientific opinion paves the way for the first marketing authorisation of a #COVID19vaccine in the EU with the corresponding safeguards, controls and obligations.
